page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: A very inadequate bus service serves the villages. It is possible to travel north, to West Meon and thence to Petersfield, Winchester or Southampton and south to Fareham and Portsmouth. However, the buses are very infrequent, take slow and circuitous routes and allow little time for shopping etc. before catching catching the only bus home. The majority of families have a car but those who do not (mostly elderly) are very cut off. Consequently a voluntary mini bus service to Fareham Shopping Centre has been organised and runs twice a week. The railway which used to come through Meonstoke, from Alton to Fareham, was closed in 1955.
